forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy. Low around 48, with temperatures rising to around 50 overnight. West northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Northwest wind around 8 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the night unfolds quietly, a gentle embrace of partly cloudy skies cradling the city. The temperature hovers around a cool 48 degrees, gradually rising to a comfortable 50. A light breeze drifts from the west-northwest at about 7 mph, adding to the serene ambiance of a wintry night. While moderate cloud cover plays a subtle game with the stars, it’s clear that any hint of fog is minimal, allowing the city lights to twinkle like distant constellations.

As dawn approaches, the promise of a sunny Tuesday emerges, with temperatures expected to peak at a pleasant 62 before retreating to the lower 60s by the afternoon. The northwest breeze may whip through the streets, moving briskly at 8 mph, hinting at the freshness of the day ahead. In anticipation of such clarity, layering becomes essential. A light jacket will serve well against the morning chill, while shedding it in the afternoon will reveal the warmth of the sunlight. This day leans toward the inviting, encouraging leisurely strolls along the waterfront or a quiet morning at your favorite café, perhaps with a book in hand, as the city awakens to the joys of a sunny embrace.
